data.text: Oil markets stabilized on Friday amid OPEC supply cuts and tensions in the Middle East, after posting their steepest falls since the start of the year earlier in the week on the back of a global economic slowdown and swelling fuel inventories.
data.title: Oil prices stabilize after sharp falls earlier in week

data.text: Cars are here to stay, whether they have drivers or not. Automakers can ensure their seat at the table by implementing strategies better suited for the digital age.
data.title: Automakers have a choice: Become data companies or become irrelevant

data.text: "If the tariffs don't get solved this year then you've got a real problem," former J.C. Penney CEO Allen Questrom says.
data.title: Former JC Penney CEO: China trade deal needed by end of year or retail's 'got a real problem'

data.text: Sentiment is "not negative enough to trigger a huge rally ... unless we get some kind of real breakthrough with China," Jim Cramer says.
data.title: Cramer: Investors are holding out hope for a trade deal — that's why the market hasn't bottomed yet

data.text: Labor-saving technology, while beneficial to everyone over time, has a different short-term effect. It enables higher productivity in a smaller number of people.
data.title: The Good And The Bad Of Job Automation

data.text: Scott Gottlieb, the former Food and Drug Administration chief, became known during his tenure for his efforts to regulate the tobacco and e-cigarette industries — and for his particular focus on Juul, the fast-growing e-cigarette company that Gottlieb squarely blames for creating a “youth epidemic” of e-cigarette use by teenagers.
data.title: Former FDA chief Scott Gottlieb has rejoined the venture world — but he hasn’t forgotten Juul

data.text: A pioneer in autonomous driving is doubling down on a self-driving technology called lidar that uses sensors to navigate through traffic, instead of cameras, just a few weeks after Tesla CEO Elon Musk called the technology "freaking stupid."
data.title: Autonomous vehicle pioneer doubles down on technology Tesla CEO Elon Musk calls 'freaking stupid'

data.text: The stocks vs bonds debate rages on. But, there's no getting around the fact that stocks always win in the end.
data.title: 5 Reasons to Invest In Stocks Versus Debt

data.text: JPMorgan Chase & Co has cut ties with Purdue Pharma LP over the OxyContin maker's alleged role in the U.S. opioid crisis, forcing it to find a new bank to manage cash and bill payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.
data.title: Exclusive: JPMorgan cuts ties with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma - sources

data.text: J.P. Morgan Chase has cut ties with Purdue Pharma LP over the OxyContin maker’s alleged role in the U.S. opioid crisis, forcing it to find a new bank to manage cash and bill payments.
data.title: JPMorgan cuts ties with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma

data.text: "That does not mean you have to sell your long positions," says billionaire Thomas Peterffy, suggesting investors hedge their stock holdings.
data.title: Interactive Brokers founder: I would not go into the summer with a long position in stocks

data.text: Jeff Bezos, Amazon boss and world’s richest man, talked to a Washington, D.C., crowd earlier this month about his futuristic vision of huge floating space colonies that would provide a sustainable home for a trillion people.
data.title: Elon Musk: Jeff Bezos’ space colony plan ‘makes no sense’

data.text: China tariffs are unnerving financial markets. Now, the matter is starting to become even more real and discussed by companies' management.
data.title: China Tariffs Already Concern These Companies

data.text: It costs a lot of money to play in Amazon’s world of retail. But brick-and-mortar retailers are doing what they can, and some are managing to improve their profitability despite spending more to compete.
data.title: Deep Dive: 20 retail stocks that have two key metrics going for them in the battle against Amazon

data.text: Indiegogo has a new chief. Andy Yang will take over for outgoing CEO David Mandelbrot who is stepping down.
data.title: Indiegogo hires Reddit’s Andy Yang as new CEO

data.text: U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods are hurting an unintended target as the country's trade war with China rages on, a study by the International Monetary Fund found.
data.title: The US tariffs on China have been paid almost entirely by US importers: IMF study

data.text: First-time claims for state unemployment benefits were expected to total 215,000 for the most recent week, up slightly from the 212,000 claims reported for the previous week.
data.title: US weekly jobless claims unexpectedly fall

data.text: Ministry of Commerce spokesperson Gao Feng says the American ban on China companies — notably Huawei Technologies —  is a threat to “the global industrial supply chain.”
data.title: China says U.S. must fix ‘wrong actions’ to mend tariff negotiation rift

data.text: Strategist Robert Buckland says global stocks have gained 7% on an annualized rate since 2010, which how much dividends have gone up in that time.
data.title: There's an easy way to predict what the stock market will ultimately return, Citigroup says

data.text: Chinese government-aligned experts are stressing that the U.S. will need to negotiate a trade agreement.
data.title: Beijing experts' latest message as trade talks stall: The US needs China
